verses.kjv: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
verses.ct: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise child brings joy to a father, but a foolish child brings grief to a mother.

verses.kjv: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
verses.ct: Wealth gained through evil does no good, but righteousness rescues from death.

verses.kjv: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
verses.ct: The LORD won't let the soul of a righteous person go hungry, but he throws aside what the wicked crave.

verses.kjv: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.ct: Lazy hands lead to poverty, but hard-working hands produce wealth.

verses.kjv: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
verses.ct: Someone who harvests during summer is wise, but someone who sleeps through the harvest brings disgrace.

verses.kjv: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
verses.ct: Blessings rest on the head of the righteous, but the words of the wicked conceal violence.

verses.kjv: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
verses.ct: The reputation of a righteous person is a blessing, but the name of the wicked will decay.

verses.kjv: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
verses.ct: A person with a wise heart accepts guidance, but a babbling fool will be ruined.

verses.kjv: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
verses.ct: Whoever lives with integrity walks in safety, but whoever takes crooked paths will be exposed.

verses.kjv: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
verses.ct: Whoever slyly winks to deceive causes pain, and a babbling fool will be ruined.

verses.kjv: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
verses.ct: What a righteous person says is a source of life, but the words of the wicked conceal violence.

verses.kjv: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
verses.ct: Hatred stirs up conflict, but love covers over every offense.

verses.kjv: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
verses.ct: Wisdom is found on the lips of a discerning person, but a rod is meant for the back of someone who lacks sense.

verses.kjv: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
verses.ct: Wise people store up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool invites disaster.

verses.kjv: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
verses.ct: A rich person's wealth is like a fortified city; the ruin of the poor is their poverty.

verses.kjv: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
verses.ct: The earnings of the righteous lead to life; the income of the wicked leads to sin.

verses.kjv: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
verses.ct: Whoever holds on to instruction is on the path to life, but whoever rejects correction goes astray.

verses.kjv: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
verses.ct: Whoever hides hatred behind dishonest words, and whoever spreads slander, is a fool.

verses.kjv: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
verses.ct: When there are too many words, sin is unavoidable, but whoever controls their tongue is wise.

verses.kjv: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
verses.ct: The speech of a righteous person is like fine silver; the heart of a wicked person is nearly worthless.

verses.kjv: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
verses.ct: The words of the righteous nourish many, but fools die because they lack sense.

verses.kjv: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
verses.ct: The blessing of the LORD brings wealth, and he doesn't add trouble along with it.

verses.kjv: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
verses.ct: Doing wrong is entertainment to a fool, but a person with understanding finds pleasure in wisdom.

verses.kjv: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
verses.ct: What the wicked dread will overtake them, but what the righteous long for will be given to them.

verses.kjv: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
verses.ct: When the storm sweeps through, the wicked are gone, but the righteous stand on an eternal foundation.

verses.kjv: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
verses.ct: Like vinegar on teeth and smoke in the eyes — that's what a lazy person is to those who send him on an errand.

verses.kjv: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
verses.ct: Deep reverence for the LORD adds years to your life, but the years of the wicked are cut short.

verses.kjv: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
verses.ct: The hope of the righteous ends in joy, but the expectations of the wicked come to nothing.

verses.kjv: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
verses.ct: The path of the LORD is a fortress for the upright, but it means destruction for those who practice evil.

verses.kjv: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
verses.ct: The righteous will never be displaced, but the wicked will not remain in the land.

verses.kjv: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
verses.ct: The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom, but a twisted tongue will be silenced.

verses.kjv: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
verses.ct: The lips of the righteous know what is fitting, but the mouth of the wicked speaks only what is perverse.
